candidates.name: Michael Marron
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in three different countries before moving to New Zealand, I have served in the Irish Army, Irish Police force, this has given me an insight into the difficulties faced by our communities. I can apply a different view when resolving these issues.
candidates.why_stand: I worked for the council for 14 years and I am passionate about the Southland District Council and representing the people who reside in the ward I am asking to represent.

candidates.name: Karyn Owen
candidates.why_elect: I'm intelligent and can offer fresh thinking to our council. I am passionate about enabling businesses and community groups to achieve their goals—always looking for win-win solutions. I've spent two years managing Te Hikoi Museum, and previously worked in tourism and economic development.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing because I want to see more diversity on council that truly reflects our population. I believe this will result in planning that better reflects our communities' needs.

candidates.name: Nick Perham
candidates.why_elect: I believe in accountability. With over 15 years in public sector management, I am well versed in policy and planning and how these get transferred into actions. I am well connected with the community, through Church, Lions Club, and trustee of Borland Lodge. I also bring significant applicable international experience.
candidates.why_stand: Community is everything to me. Which is why I am running for a second term on Council. I strongly believe in the concept of "small council, big communities." I want to empower our communities to achieve their own goals; supporting and enabling people, without the hitches of needless bureaucracy.

candidates.name: Don Byars
candidates.why_elect: I have generally been self-employed and appreciate the need to be competitive. A keen interest in economics and marketing has helped in this regard. A good strategic thinker, I'm quite comfortable considering solutions that lie outside the norm. My family and I are fortunate to live in Riverton.
candidates.why_stand: I am motivated by helping our community adapt and change so we able to face the future from a position of security. I would like to help create opportunities for our young people. I believe the council exists to empower the community rather than to direct it.

candidates.name: George Harpur
candidates.why_elect: born in Tuatapere and have been involved in our community ever since, transport, business management, many of our sporting clubs and a few other interests. currently on my 5th term as your councillor. I am familiar with farming and forestry and most things that make our region function. thank you.
candidates.why_stand: With the advent of the Great Walk upgrade to the Hump Ridge track, Tuatapere and all areas adjacent to the Southern Scenic Route may well be on the verge of a major increase in tourist traffic flow. We must compete for our market share. For us and our children.

candidates.before_politics: Retired operate a small B n B
candidates.name: Ron Hibbs
candidates.why_elect: In the past I have been involved with many community groups, including Boards of Trustees, I have managed a disabilities trust that provided day services. I have been involved in retail including owning my own successful business. I know the difference between management and governance.
candidates.why_stand: When looking for an area to retire in I chose Tuatapere because of its small town vibe. Tuatapere has so much going for it, it has a moderate climate, great access to the outdoors and friendly and helpful people. Tuatapere is only an hours drive from a big urban centre.
